title: Adding a zero balance custom token gives bad UX

labels.name: type: issue
labels.description: Items that document a problem or bug with an existing feature.

body:
### Description of the Issue

When adding a custom token, if you do not select the checkbox to "save" the custom token, then it wont appear to the user, but we still save the custom token in local storage. This means that if the user tries to add the same name again, they'll get a name conflict with no way of removing the conflicting token unless they "scan for tokens" again to get the previously added token.

- The custom token should not have been saved if the checkbox is not clicked, or the checkbox should not be presented to the user when adding a custom token

- The option to remove the custom token should always appear to the user

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Wipe local storage
2. Add use a wallet that has no tokens
3. Scan for tokens
4. Add a custom token with 0 balance
5. Do not check the box to save the token
6. Press the save button
![2018-05-12-134250_557x263_scrot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6404866/39960098-5f6f99f4-55ea-11e8-9548-02af372cfab8.png)
7. No tokens found should appear
![2018-05-12-134342_535x198_scrot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6404866/39960102-80281130-55ea-11e8-8579-fb61acdcc3f5.png)
8. You should be unable to remove the custom token 
9. Try adding the same custom token again
10. You get `A token with this symbol already exists, but you can't remove it
11. Only way to remove is to scan tokens again, then the custom token will appear again
![2018-05-12-134427_549x221_scrot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6404866/39960105-9b8c58b4-55ea-11e8-8755-f90f08a14ad7.png)
